Guide.title: Python Learning Guide
Guide.intro: A step-by-step guide to becoming a proficient Python developer, based on how I learned Python.

step1.title: Learn the Basics
step1.content: First, you need to learn the most elementary concepts like print statements and other fundamental programming ideas. There are two recommended approaches:

options.option1: Watch Fireship (the fast videos) and dive right in with hands-on practice. This is great if you prefer a more practical learning style.
options.option2: Follow a structured tutorial or course. Recommended options include Mosh or Tech with Tim. Mosh offers an excellent beginner tutorial covering the fundamentals of Python.

step2.title: Build Simple Projects
step2.content: Next, gain practical experience with small projects. Try creating simple games like tic-tac-toe or grid-based games like Connect 4.

step3.title: Learn Git
step3.content: To become a developer, you must understand Git. It's much easier than it looks. Fireship has many useful videos that explain Git and how to use it effectively.

step4.title: Take on Challenging Projects
step4.content: Now that you've mastered the basics, challenge yourself with more complex projects that seem initially beyond your current skill level.

details.detail1: Choose projects that inspire you or spark your curiosity.
details.detail2: Your project should incorporate new concepts such as:

examples.title: Project Examples
examples.example1: A basic website that uses a public API to display information
examples.example2: A game with a proper graphical interface

step5.title: Build a Full-Stack Application
step5.content: It's time to put everything together by creating a complete full-stack application with proper Git usage, a database, and a professional webpage built with HTML, CSS, and possibly JavaScript.

step6.title: Practice for Technical Interviews
step6.content: Now that you're a developer, prepare for technical interviews by practicing data structures and algorithms. These can be challenging but are crucial for job applications. Practice on platforms like LeetCode or NeetCode.
